docs.lead_paragraph: People whose jobs involve a lot of lifting may need to take longer breaks than is often the case now to avoid back injuries, a new study finds. This seems to be especially true for people new to the job. Writing in a recent issue of Clinical Biomechanics, researchers said the breaks that are now typical in industry might not be enough.

headline.main: Heavy Lifters May Need Longer Breaks

docs.abstract: Gang Yang of Ohio State University leads study on impact of lifting boxes on back muscles; research, which is published in journal Clinical Biomechanics, finds that people who do lot of lifting may need longer breaks to give back time to recover; suggests that ability to keep oxygen levels high is vital to preventing muscle fatigue; drawing (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: THE CLAIM -- Mother's heartburn means a hairy newborn. THE FACTS -- It is an odd adage that has stuck around for ages: women who suffer heartburn during pregnancy will have babies with full heads of hair. But doctors have long shrugged it off.
